definition: cast (of a movie etc)/lineup of performers/troupe
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration

sentences.english: The budget will depend on the script, what kind of financing the producer can get, and also who is cast in the movie.
sentences.chinese: 预算取决于剧本，获得的投资以及影片的演员阵容。
他同意这样的演员阵容。

sentences.english: No budget was announced but it will be subject to cast.
sentences.chinese: 影片预算还未公布，但这将主要取决于演员阵容。

sentences.english: Moreover, the film's powerful cast is entirely a product of the occasion.
sentences.chinese: 更何况影片超强的演员阵容完全是应景产物。

sentences.english: They all come from different parts of the globe, making this a truly international cast.
sentences.chinese: 他们来自世界各地，使之成为真正国际性的演员阵容。

sentences.english: The cast of The Secret Circle continues to grow.
sentences.chinese: 《吸血鬼日记》姐妹篇《秘圈》继续充实演员阵容。

sentences.english: The cast of this movie included a famous actor.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影的演员阵容包括了一名著名的男演员。

sentences.english: Another highlight of the movie is its all-star cast.
sentences.chinese: 该片的另一个焦点在于明星云集的演员阵容。

sentences.english: The Beijing Theatre of People's Art has a very strong cast.
sentences.chinese: 北京人民艺术剧院有很强大的演员阵容。

sentences.english: The film's success partly lies in the strength of the supporting cast.
sentences.chinese: 影片的成功部分原因在于配角演员阵容强大。

definition: to act the leading role (in a movie or a play)/to star/lead actor
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
to appear (in a show etc)/an appearance (on stage etc)
